snippet: The assault late Friday on one of the best-defended posts in Afghanistan was troubling because the attackers were able to penetrate the base, killing two and causing more than $200 million in damage.
abstract: Audacious Taliban attack on a heavily fortified base in southern Afghanistan did far more damage than initially reported, destroying or severely damaging eight attack jets in the most destructive single strike on Western armament in the 11-year war; NATO officials say complex attack was conducted by three tightly choreographed teams of militants wearing American Army uniforms, and is a reminder that the Taliban remain capable of serious assaults.

byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg and Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The assault late Friday on one of the best-defended posts in Afghanistan was troubling because the attackers were able to penetrate the base, killing two and causing more than $200 million in damage.

headline.seo: Taliban Raid on NATO Base Inflicted Severe Damage
headline.main: Audacious Raid on NATO Base Shows Taliban’s Reach
headline.print_headline: Audacious Raid On Nato Shows Taliban's Reach

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
